OP62610-d-06-26-10-WTJR.Reporting Railroad Name: WICHITA, TILLMAN & JACKSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.
OP62610-d-06-26-10-WTJR.Maintenance Railroad Name: WICHITA, TILLMAN & JACKSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.
OP62610-d-06-26-10-WTJR.Narrative:
ON 6/26/10 AT APPROXIMATELY 23:00 THE UP5682 PULLED THROUGH TRACK 5 IN WICHITA YARD WITH 98 EMPTY CARS.  THE ENGINEER AND THE CONDUCTOR HAD BEEN INSTRUCTED TO FILL TRACK 5 THEN PUT BALANCE OF CARS INTRACKS 4 AND 6 LEAVING TRACK 3 OPEN TO RETURN TO THE EAST END OF THE YARD AND WTJR HAD PULLED 4 LOCOMOTIVES AND 25 LOADS OUT TO AIRPORT ROAD ON THE MAIN LINE, HOWEVER, HE SHOULD HAVE PLENTY OF ROOM TOYARD HIS TRAIN.  THE CONDUCTOR SECURED THE EMPTY CARS ON TRACK 5, MADE A CUT BETWEEN UP87730 (55THCAR) AND THE UP79204 (58TH CAR), AND HAD ENGINEER PULL AHEAD.  UP CONDUCTOR PROCEEDED TO SHOVE THE EMPTIES BACK INTO TRACK 4 WHEN THE UP79204 STRUCK THE UP87730 LIFTING BOTH CARS UP AND SHOVING THEM ACROSS THE YARD STRIKING THE UP87494 ON THE MAIN LINE.  THE UP87730 APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN 1/2 OF A CARLENGTH PAST THE CLEARANCE POINT MARKED ON THE RAIL.  FOUR CARS WERE DERAILED AT THE WEST END OF THEYARD.  THE WEST TRUCK OF THE CHTT 721807, CAR #60, EAST OF THE UP87730.  BOTH TRUCKS ON THE UP87730, BOTH TRUCKS OF THE UP79204 AND BOTH TRUCKS OF THE NAHX70163 CAR #57, WEST OF THE UP79204.  THE EVENT RECORDER SHOWED UP ENGINEER MOVING BETWEEN 4-5 MPH.  UP CONDUCTOR HURT HIS BACK AND WAS TAKEN TOTHE HOSPITAL.  

WTJR BELIEVES HUMAN ERROR TO BE CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT.  THE UP87730 WAS LEFT FOULING TRACK FOUR.  THE CLEARANCE POINT WAS MARKED AND THERE WAS AMPLE ROOM IN FRONT OF THE UP5682 TO HAVE PULLED THE UP87730 AND SET IT TO TRACK FOUR.

20101-d-06-19-10-HR.Primary Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
20101-d-06-19-10-HR.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
20101-d-06-19-10-HR.Narrative: SOUTHERN APPALACHIA RAILWAY MUSEUM EXCURSION TRAIN X2561 NORTH DERAILED ON THE HERITAGE RAILROAD NEAR MP 3.8.  THE R2 WHEEL OF LOCOMOTIVE 1315 (1315 SHUTDOWN, UNOCCUPIED, AND BEING TOWED BACKWARD AT THE REAR OF THE TRAIN) DROPPED INTO THE GAGE AS THE UNIT ENTERED THE BODY OF A 10 DEGREE CURVE.  THETRAIN WAS TRAVELING 17 MPH, #3 THROTTLE, LOADING 400 AMPS AT THE TIME OF THE DERAILMENT.  THOUGH DERAILED, 1315 REMAINED UPRIGHT FOR ROUGHLY 400 FEET UNTIL THE DERAILED R2 WHEEL CONTACTED THE FROG OFTHE NE 327 SIDING SWITCH.  AT THAT TIME THE FROG AND CURVED CLOSURE RAIL OF THE SWITCH SERVED TO GUIDE THE REST OF THE #1 TRUCK AND SUBSEQUENTLY THE LOCOMOTIVE OFF THE TRACK, LAYING IT OVER ON ITS SIDE.  THE DERAILING OF LOCOMOTIVE 1315 ALSO LIFTED THE ADJACENT CAR (UNOCCUPIED CABOOSE, SOUTHERN X261) OFF ITS TRUCKS AND IT CAME TO REST, STILL COUPLED AT BOTH ENDS, AT A 45 DEGREE ANGLE.  THE ENGINEER NOTICED THE DERAILED WHEEL AND APPLIED THE BRAKES IN "EMERGENCY" AT ROUGHLY THE SAME TIME THE DERAILED WHEEL STRUCK THE SWITCH.  NO EMPLOYEES OR PASSENGERS WERE INJURED, AND THE TRAIN WAS NOT CARRYING ANY HAZ-MAT.  THERE WAS A SMALL FUEL SPILL FROM LOCOMOTIVE 1315 WHICH WAS CONTAINED ON THE RR ROW, AND CLEANED UP BY A LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONTRACTOR.

20101-d-06-19-10-SPRX.Primary Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)

20101-d-06-19-10-SPRX.Narrative: SOUTHERN APPALACHIA RAILWAY MUSEUM EXCURSION TRAIN X2561 NORTH DERAILED ON THE HERITAGE RAILROAD NEAR MP 3.8.  THE R2 WHEEL OF LOCOMOTIVE 1315 (1315 SHUTDOWN, UNOCCUPIED, AND BEING TOWED BACKWARD AT THE REAR OF THE TRAIN) DROPPED INTO THE GAGE AS THE UNIT ENTERED THE BODY OF A 10 DEGREE CURVE.  THETRAIN WAS TRAVELING 17 MPH, #3 THROTTLE, LOADING 400 AMPS AT THE TIME OF THE DERAILMENT.  THOUGH DERAILED, 1315 REMAINED UPRIGHT FOR ROUGHLY 400 FEET UNTIL THE DERAILED R2 WHEEL CONTACTED THE FROG OFTHE NE 327 SIDING SWITCH.  AT THAT TIME THE FROG AND CURVED CLOSURE RAIL OF THE SWITCH SERVED TO GUIDE THE REST OF THE #1 TRUCK AND SUBSEQUENTLY THE LOCOMOTIVE OFF THE TRACK, LAYING IT OVER ON ITS SIDE.  THE DERAILING OF LOCOMOTIVE 1315 ALSO LIFTED THE ADJACENT CAR (UNOCCUPIED CABOOSE, SOUTHERN X261) OFF ITS TRUCKS AND IT CAME TO REST, STILL COUPLED AT BOTH ENDS, AT A 45 DEGREE ANGLE.  THE ENGINEER NOTICED THE DERAILED WHEEL AND APPLIED THE BRAKES IN "EMERGENCY" AT ROUGHLY THE SAME TIME THE DERAILED WHEEL STRUCK THE SWITCH.  NO EMPLOYEES OR PASSENGERS WERE INJURED, AND THE TRAIN WAS NOT CARRYING ANY HAZ-MAT.  THERE WAS A SMALL FUEL SPILL FROM LOCOMOTIVE 1315 WHICH WAS CONTAINED ON THE RR ROW, AND CLEANED UP BY A LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONTRACTOR.

23F061021-d-06-18-10-GRW.Narrative: CREW HAD 23 LOADED COKE CARS AND WERE SHOVING NORTH TO SOUTH SPOTTING THE BLAST FURNACES.  THE FOREMAN WAS RIDING THE POINT CAR FACING SOUTH AND STOPPED THE MOVEMENT TO GET OFF AND WALK NORTH TO UNCOUPLE THE CARS TO SPOT #4 AND THEN #6.  HE TOLD THE ENGINEER TO MOVE 10 FEET SOUTH TO SPOT #4 AND TOOKNO EXCEPTIONS AS THE CARS WERE MOVED 10 MORE FEET SOUTH.  AS HE PROCEEDED TO WALK NORTH, IT WAS THEN HE NOTICED THE SUBSEQUENT SIX CARS WERE DERAILED AND NOTIFIED THE YARDMASTER.  A HISTORY OF THE CARS REVEALED NO DEFECTS AND ALL HAVE MADE SEVERAL ROUND TRIPS UP AND DOWN THE HI-LINE.  ABOUT 160 FEET SOUTH OF #6 BLAST FURNACE, THE RAIL GAUGE WAS WIDE AND SEVERAL RAIL FASTENERS WERE BROKEN LOOSE.THIS WAS DETERMINED TO BE THE PRIMARY CAUSE OF THE INCIDENT.  A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR MAY ALSO HAVE BEEN THE 93 DEGREE AMBIENT TEMPERATURE, WHICH CAN CAUSE RAIL TO EXPAND.

672970-d-06-06-10-DMIR.Narrative: U79381-05 WAS A LOADED ORE TRAIN TRAVELING AT 36 MPH ON CWR MAIN LINE TRACK WHEN IT WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND STOPPED.  THE CONDUCTOR INSPECTED THE TRAIN AND FOUND DMIR 52648, 53117, 51826, 52227, 513824, 51205, 52695, 52803, 52769, 52825, 52729, 52503, 52792, AND 52958 DERAILED.  TRACK WAS DAMAGED BETWEEN FAIRBANKS AND BRIMSON INCLUDING NORTH SWITCH AT BRIMSON.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE DERAILMENT FOUND THAT THE CAUSE WAS AN INCOMPATIBLE FOR THE LEGACY CARS WITH D2 SPRINGS ON CLASS 4 TRACK RESULTING IN A VEHICLE RESONANCE.  THE FRA TRACK CLASS ID DESIGNED FOR 60' CARS AND NOT 24' CARS, AND THE D2SUSPENSIONS ARE ONLY ALLOWED IN GRANDFATHERS DESIGNS.  THE STIFFER SUSPENSIONS COMBINED WITH THE SHORT CAR LENGTH REACT TO TRACK DEVIATIONS THAT THOUGH LEGAL BY FRA CRITERIA ARE NOT COMPATIBLE FOR THE 24' CAR.  MEASURES ARE BEING TAKEN TO REPLACE/UPDATE THE SUSPENSIONS AND ALSO LOOKING INTO TRACK DESIGN STANDARDS TO FIND SOMETHING MORE COMPATIBLE WITH 24' CAR.  CARS SCRAPPED:  DMIR 51826, 52227,51824,  51205, 52695, 52803, 52769, 52825, 52729, 52503, 52792, 52958.

000077088-d-06-21-10-CSX.Narrative: Y29621 WAS HUMPING R02 ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE HUMP. YARDMASTER NOTICED THE WHEEL DETECTOR WAS GIVING HIM TROUBLE AND CAUSING MISROUTES. HE CALLED THE MAINTAINER AND REPORTED IT. THE MAINTAINER WENTAND LOOKED AT THE WHEEL DETECTOR AND INFORMED THE YARDMASTER HE NEEDED A LITTLE TIME TO WORK ON IT.THE MAINTAINER GIVE THE OK TO FINISH THE FEW CARS HE HAD LEFT AND THEN HE WOULD MAKE THE REPAIRS. WHEN HE RESUMED HUMPING CONDUCTOR Y29621 PULLED A DOUBLE (CSXT 292989 AND CSXT 291238)AND THE AS THE CARS WERE DESCENDING DOWN THE HILL TOWARDS B63 THE EAST MOST CAR (CSXT 291238) TRIED TO GO IN TWO DIFFERENT DIRECTIONS AT THE B01-B64 SWITCH ON THE NORTHSIDE. THE WEST SET OF TRUCKS WENT TO THE SOUTH SIDE AND THE EAST SET OF TRUCKS WENT TO THE NORTH SIDE CAUSING THE CAR TO TURN SIDE WAYS AND DERAIL.Y29621 HAD ALREADY PULLED ANOTHER DOUBLE ( CSXT 292524 AND CSXT 312210) AND COULD NOT STOP THE CARSFROM GOING DOWN THE HILL AND CRASHING INTO THE CSXT 291238 AND THE CSXT 292989. THE CSXT 291238 TURNED OVER DUMPING ROCK EVERYWHERE AND THE CSXT 292524 AND CSXT 312210 DERAILED WHEN THEY CRASHED INTOTHE CSXT 291238 AND THE CSXT 292989. THE CSXT 292989 ROLLED ON DOWN INTO B63 LEAVING THE REMAINING 3CARS DERAILED BLOCKING BOTH THE NORTH AND SOUTH SIDE OF THE HUMP STOPPING ALL OPERATIONS.

672948-d-06-05-10-WC.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing spikes or other rail fasteners)
672948-d-06-05-10-WC.Narrative: A44681-05 WAS YARDING TRAIN IN THE BRC RECEIVING YARD ON TRACK #7.  AFTER ENTERING TRACK 7 HEADING EAST THE CREW NOTICED THAT THEY HAD DERAILED AND STOPPED THEIR MOVEMENT.  THE ENGINES AND THE FIRST TEN CARS OF TRAIN WENT INTO TRACK 7 AND THE REST OFF THE TRAIN STARTED PROCEEDING INTO TRACK 8.  ONECAR DERAILED (ATW400457) NOT DANGEROUS BETWEEN TRACKS 7 AND 8 STILL ATTACHED TO CARS ON BOTH TRACKS.ONE SET OF TRUCKS WAS DERAILED ON THE A-END.  INVESTIGATION DETERMINED THE CAUSE TO BE WIDE GAUGEAT THE FROG LEADING TO THE SWITCH.  THE BRC REPORTED $4,260 TRACK DAMAGE.  THE BRC TRAINMASTER AGREED WITH THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT.

CH0610111-d-06-24-10-BNSF.Narrative: S-SEALPC1-19 WAS PULLING INTO LOGISTICS PARK ON LOOP 1 TRACK THROUGH 4300 XOVER TO TRACK 4502, WHICHHAD BEEN LINED FOR MOVE.  CREW NOTED TRAIN PULLING HARD AND STOPPED.  INSPECTION REVEALED 3 CARS DERAILED ON 4500 LEAD.  TRAIN HANDLING ARTICULATED EQUIPMENT.  PER TR&D, UPDATED CAUSE CODE TO SHOW T314 AND E46C.

0610LA011-d-06-17-10-UP.Narrative: THE YWC40R-16 WAS SHOVING TRACK 205 FROM THE RECEIVING YARD TO THE HUMP LEAD FOR HUMPING.  WHEN THECUT REACHED THE CEDAR AVENUE BRIDGE, A LOCOMOTIVE COMM FAILURE CAUSED INDEPENDENT BRAKES TO SET WHICH RESULTED IN A BROKEN TRAIN AT A WEAK KNUCKLE AT 18TH CAR.  17 CARS BROKE AWAY AND ROLLED TOWARD THE BOWL.  THE YARDMASTER LINED THE CARS TOWARDS TRACK 72 IN ACCORDANCE WITH BREAKAWAY PROCEDURES.  THE CARS IMPACTED STANDING CARS IN TRACK 72.  A TOTAL OF 11 CARS DERAILED.

CA0610116-d-06-21-10-BNSF.Narrative: TRACK 1441 HAD BEEN HUMPED INTO UNTIL FULL WITH ONE CAR IN FOUL.  LATER, ANOTHER CUT  WAS HUMPED WITH CARS FOR 1442 TRACK, WHICH SIDESWIPED THE CAR LEFT IN FOUL.

116157-d-06-23-10-ATK.Narrative: TRAIN 702 OPERATING WITH CAB CAR C/6962 IN LEAD, 3 CARS AND LOCOMOTIVE E/175 IN THE REAR, STRUCK A SEMI-TRACTOR TRUCK AT MP1070.19, EL CAPITAN WAY CROSSING.

ITSL1001-d-06-08-10-ITSL.Accident Cause: Interference (other than vandalism) with railroad operations by nonrailroad employee
ITSL1001-d-06-08-10-ITSL.Narrative: ITS SWITCH CREW COUPLED TO THE WEST END OF 27 EMPTY DOUBLE STACK RAILCARS (SOME ARTICULATED) IN TRACK 201.  WHEN THEY MOVED WEST 5 CARS LENGTHS THE TRAIN ROLLED DOWN SO THE ENGINEER STOPPED.  THE REARCAR WAS STRADDLE THE 201/203 CROSS-OVER SWITCH AND THE EAST TRUCKS WENT INTO THE CROSS-OVER.  INSPECTION SHOWED SWITCH IN PERFECT CONDITION.  SWITCH HAD BEEN LINED AND LATCHED FOR DIVERGING MOVEMENTBY UNKNOWN PERSON.

0610DV001-d-06-03-10-UP.Narrative: CEGWE9-28, WITH LEAD UNIT UP5964 WAS HEADING EAST AND STRUCK A TRACTOR TRAILER RIG HAULING ROCK AT MP74.75 ON NORTH FORK SUB.  NO INJURIES TO CREW.  TRACTOR TRAILER RIG DROVE AROUND DOWN GATES AT THECROSSING AND WAS STRUCK IN THE CENTER ON THE PASSENGER SIDE BY THE CEGWE9-28.  DRIVER WENT TO HOSPITAL AND WAS TREATED/RELEASED.  DRIVER WAS ISSUED A CITATION.  RAIL = CWR

220487-d-06-22-10-DME.Narrative: CREW ON THE 820-022 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SPOTTING THE LOADED COAL TRAIN INTO THE MID AMERICAN ENERGY PLANT WHEN THE MRDX 213 PICKED THE NUMBER ONE SWITCH CAUSING THE CAR TO TRAVEL DOWN TWO SEPARATE TRACKS EVENTUALLY DAMAGING THE TRACK AND CAUSING FIVE OTHER CARS TO DERAIL AND THEN SIDESWIPING THE HEAD CAR MRDX 130 STANDING ON TWO TRACK.

220484-d-06-20-10-DME.Accident Cause: Failure to apply hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
220484-d-06-20-10-DME.Narrative: B82 LOCAL KICKED GATX 95966 INTO 4 TRACK, CHECKED CAR AND IT WAS SITTING STILL.  PULLED EASTWARD ONLEAD TWO CAR LENGTHS AND AGAIN CHECKED GATX 95966 AND IT WAS SITTING STILL.  LINED SWITCH, WALKED THREE CAR LENGTHS UP LEAD AND KICKED MLSX 20600 ALONG WITH TWO OTHER CARS INTO 5 TRACK.  GATX 95966 HAD ROLLED OUT TO FOUL 5 TRACK AND CORNERED MLSX 20600.  CARS DID NOT DERAIL, BUT WERE DAMAGED.  CRV ITEM B PER C. NEWTON.

0610TC001-d-06-02-10-UP.Primary Accident Cause: Other locomotive defects (Provide detail description in narrative)
0610TC001-d-06-02-10-UP.Accident Cause: Other locomotive defects (Provide detail description in narrative)
0610TC001-d-06-02-10-UP.Narrative: MEADM-02 HAD STALLED OUT ON THE HILL AT MP 91.26.  2ND UNIT IN THE CONSIST UP5102 HAD EXPERIENCED GENERATOR FAULTS AND APPARENTLY SPUN ITS WHEELS AND DID NOT GIVE ANY INDICATION TO THE LEAD UNIT UP4187 THAT WHEEL SLIP WAS OCCURRING.  CREW NOTICED BLACK SMOKE FROM 2ND UNIT, STOPPED AND FOUND WHEEL BURNS.  DURING THE WHEEL SPIN, THE TRAIN MADE NO FORWARD OR REVERSE MOVEMENT.  ELECTRICAL FAILURE ONLY.  NO DAMAGE TO LOCOMOTIVE.  RAIL = CWR

D501110-d-06-12-10-EIRR.Narrative: CREW WAS SHOVING INTO THE PEAVEY 746 TRACK, ENGINEER HEARD POPPING SOUNDS AND THEN THE LOCOMOTIVE BEGAN TO SHAKE, THE ENGINEER PUT TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY AT 5 MPH AND INSTRUCTED THE CONDUCTOR TO WALK TRAIN.  AFTER THE CONDUCTOR WALKED TOWARDS THE MOTOR HE FOUND THREE CARS HAD DERAILED AND THE LOCOMOTIVE.

0610PC006-d-06-27-10-UP.Narrative: LCF33-27 WAS SWITCHING DANGEROUS TANK CARS BACK INTO TRAIN AND AFTER COVERING WITH BUFFER CARS, THEYSTRETCHED TRAIN AND THEN BEGAN MOVING A SHOVING MOVE WITH CONDUCTOR PROTECTING POINT.  AFTER TRAINCAME TO ABRUPT STOP AFTER MOVING APPROXIMATELY 3 CAR LENGTHS, INSPECTION FOUND THAT 4 CARS HAD DERAILED.

0610PC004-d-06-14-10-UP.Narrative: IDUSE-11 DEPARTING EAST YARD OUT OF CROSSOVER, WHEN THE HEAD CAR OF A THREE CAR ARTICULATED PIGGYBACK, DERAILED FROM TRUCK HUNTING AND CLIMBING THE RAIL AT THE SWITCH POINT.  SWITCH POINT WAS WORN ANDHAD LITTLE MOVEMENT, BUT THE TRUCKS ON DTTA729568 AND DTTC729568 WERE NOT TRACKING STRAIGHT.  DTTA729568 THEN STRUCK THE ARMN933962 ON ADJACENT TRACK, DERAILING IT AND 2 OTHER CARS.
